title: U.S. Attorney Investigating Letitia James Resigns After Trump Seeks to Oust Him
summary: Erik S. Siebert had hit roadblocks investigating New York’s attorney general, Letitia James, and the former F.B.I. director James B. Comey.

title: Trump Says U.S. Will Institute $100,000 Fee for H-1B Visas
summary: Administration officials said the charge would help American workers. President Trump also announced the terms of a new “gold card” program.

title: Trump Says U.S. Military Attacked a Third Suspected Drug Boat, Killing Three
summary: It was the third time this month that the president said the United States had struck a vessel in the Caribbean Sea.

title: Pentagon Introduces New Restrictions on Reporter Access
summary: The Department of Defense will force reporters to pledge not to gather or use any information that had not been formally authorized for release, or risk losing their credential to cover the military.

title: With Calls for Retribution Over Kirk, Some See Rise of a ‘Woke Right’
summary: Conservatives have pressed for consequences for those who make negative comments about Charlie Kirk. But a few on the right say they worry about limits on speech.

title: Ted Cruz Accuses FCC Chair of Mafia-Like Tactics Amid Jimmy Kimmel Fallout
summary: The Republican senator warned that retaliating against media outlets over coverage that conservatives view as negative would set a “dangerous” precedent.

title: Kennedy’s Vaccine Panel Votes to Limit Access to Covid Shots
summary: The panel recommended that people consult a health professional before receiving a Covid vaccine. Left unclear was whether Americans can still walk into pharmacies for shots.

title: What to Know About Covid Vaccines This Fall
summary: The F.D.A. and the C.D.C. have both weighed in, but confusion remains. Here’s what to know.

title: Still Divided, a Syrian City Ruined in War Edges Back to Life
summary: Battered by years of bombing and shelling, Deir al-Zour remains a frontline, even as its people struggle to rebuild.

title: Trump Administration Will End Deportation Protections for Thousands of Syrians
summary: A homeland security official said it was “contrary to our national interest to allow Syrians to remain in our country” through the temporary program.

title: After 50 Years, the Magic Circle (Finally) Inducts Penn & Teller
summary: There had been resistance to admitting the duo because of their willingness to reveal the secrets behind their illusions. But it was always more complicated than that.

title: Penn & Teller’s Secret to a 50-Year Partnership
summary: As their magic act hits 50 years, they’re bigger than ever. They say their secret is not to socialize. But misdirection is also their love language.

title: What U.S.-Korea Ties Mean on the 75th Anniversary of the Incheon Landing
summary: Incheon, the site of a crucial battle of the Korean War, has a singular place in South Korea’s modern history and in its ties with the United States.

title: Hard-Fought Treaty to Protect Ocean Life Clears a Final Hurdle
summary: The global High Seas Treaty, decades in the making, will become international law. It aims to create vast maritime conservation areas.

title: Trump Nears Deal for Road Through Alaskan Wildlife Refuge
summary: Proponents say the road would connect a remote town with an airport used for medical evacuations. Opponents say it would cause irreparable harm to wildlife and Alaska Native tribes.

title: Russian Fighter Jets Enter Airspace of Estonia, a NATO Member
summary: Estonia’s foreign minister described the flights, which lasted for an unusually long 12 minutes, as an “unprecedentedly brazen” intrusion.

title: Harvard’s Former President, Claudine Gay, Criticizes Its Approach to Trump
summary: Claudine Gay has rarely spoken out since she was forced to resign, but she recently said that Harvard should not cave to Trump administration demands, including a $500 million payment.

title: Trump Officials Question Harvard’s Stability, Saying Federal Inquiries Raise Financial Risk
summary: The administration’s latest attack on the nation’s oldest university comes as negotiations stall for a settlement to restore billions in frozen federal research funds.

title: As Farm Aid Reaches 40 Years, It Deals With Familiar Farming Crises
summary: Saturday’s star-studded concert will air on TV for the first time in years as the hotline for farmers gets more calls about a mix of complicated problems.

title: Schumer, Wary of Blowback, Holds Out on Mamdani
summary: Will the Senate minority leader, the avatar of old New York politics, endorse the young, up-and-coming democratic socialist?

title: She’s Starting a Blood Bank for Zoos
summary: Captive animals sometimes need a transfusion, but the typical approach to blood banking isn’t practical for zoos and aquariums. One veterinarian is testing a solution.

title: Kennedy’s Vaccine Mess
summary: We definitely need to restore America’s trust in vaccines, but the amateur hour A.C.I.P. display isn’t going to do it.

title: Political Violence Isn’t New. The Trump Administration’s Response to It Is.
summary: Who will be next?

title: Trump Hails Progress on TikTok Deal After Call With Xi
summary: President Trump said he would meet with President Xi Jinping next month in South Korea. Mr. Xi said he welcomes a TikTok deal that would benefit both sides.

title: FDA OKs New Keytruda Shot for Cancer
summary: The F.D.A. approved Merck’s injected version of its blockbuster infusion Keytruda. The company says it will be quicker and easier, but it stands to slow the adoption of cheaper competitors and increase costs by billions of dollars.

title: Travis Decker’s Remains Believed to Be Found in Forest, Sheriff Says
summary: A search team recovered remains believed to be those of Travis Decker in a forest about 120 miles east of Seattle, the authorities said.

title: Pregnant Women Should Not Use Cannabis, New Medical Guidelines Say
summary: Marijuana during pregnancy is linked to poor birth outcomes and developmental delays in children, a leading medical society advised.
